title: Dietrich Müller-Doblies
text: Dietrich Müller-Doblies (born 1938) is a German systematic botanist. His main areas of interest are the <a href="Moss">Bryophyta</a>, the <a href="Spermatophyta">Spermatophyta</a>, the <a href="Monocotyledons">Monocotyledons</a>, <a href="Amaryllidaceae">Amaryllidaceae</a>, <a href="Colchicaceae">Colchicaceae</a> and <a href="Hyacinthaceae">Hyacinthaceae</a>. He is currently at the Herbarium of the <a href="Technische%20Universit%C3%A4t">Technische Universität</a> <a href="Berlin">Berlin</a> Most of his botanical writings are in conjunction with , whose author abbreviation is U.Müll.-Doblies, however most taxa named by them bear both names, signified by D.Müll.-Doblies & U.Müll.-Doblies or D. & U. M.-D. and sometimes D. et U. M.-D..
